image.altText: Mr Squiggle and his blackboard on display.

props.synopsis: Mr Squiggle lit up TV screens for 40 years. Now, the National Museum of Australia in Canberra is displaying the show's iconic items.

title.children: Mr Squiggle, the man from the moon, is novel for kids, nostalgic for parents

image.altText: A uni lecturer

props.synopsis: The Australian National University announces more staff cuts across academic and professional roles, as part of its broader goal to save $250 million by the end of the year.

title.children: 'Awful': Amelia's in an ANU redundancy pool with two close colleagues

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The court heard the 38-year-old man went to a Canberra apartment looking for a woman who owed him $100,000, pushing his way in with another man and assaulting the couple inside.

title.children: Chinese national found guilty over part in violent home invasion

image.altText: A apartment building with cars driving on a main road in the foreground.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into strata management in Canberra hears of some unit owners struggling to pay levies and ending up bankrupt with no legal protections.

title.children: 'Losing their homes': Unit owners facing bankruptcy after strata action

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: Canberra man Brandon D'Alessandro is jailed after pleading guilty to more than 40 charges, including aggravated burglary, theft, and driving a stolen car.

title.children: Getaway driver for group that stole $200 worth of Subway cookies jailed

image.altText: The exterior of a white marble building with a sign reading "Law Court of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: A disability worker tells the ACT Supreme Court a quadriplegic man she cares for was "devastated" and cried when he realised his bank account was empty after an alleged fraud committed by his friend.

title.children: Man on trial for allegedly stealing from quadriplegic friend

image.altText: Three generations of women sitting on a couch.

props.synopsis: For Canberra woman Belle Hogg, the first sign her life was about to change came when her mother forgot her birthday. Suddenly she found herself juggling full-time work, a photography business, raising her three children and caring for her mother.

title.children: Belle's aging mum forgot her birthday. It was the first sign of change

image.altText: Sean Combs, wearing a black jacket, looks neutrally off camera in front of plastered logos.

props.synopsis: A relieved Sean Combs claps his hands in court and tells his family he will be home soon, but the matter is not over yet.

title.children: Diddy celebrated the jury's verdict as a victory, but his legal woes are far from over

image.altText: A man raises his cricket bat in celebration of a half century.

props.synopsis: Australia rebuilds after yet another top-order collapse on day one of the second Test against the West Indies in Grenada. Follow live.

title.children: Webster and Carey lead Australian fightback against West Indies

image.altText: A woman with short hair smiles standing in front of a Qantas airplane in a hangar.

props.synopsis: Qantas has sent emails to customers affected or potentially affected by a cyber attack, but none of its executives have yet fronted the media.

title.children: Flying kangaroo goes to ground on data breach

image.altText: A silhouette of a hand holds a mobile phone with a blank white screen

props.synopsis: I was transferring my mobile number to a new provider when my phone service cut out. That was my first clue that my identity had been stolen.

title.children: My credit score was trashed. Then I found out my identity had been stolen

image.altText: Michael Madsen in a black suit jacket and white shirt smiling while standing in front of a black red carpet banner

props.synopsis: Michael Madsen, whose menacing characters in Reservoir Dogs and Kill Bill made him a stand-out in Quentin Tarantino's films, dies aged 66.

title.children: Reservoir Dogs and Kill Bill star Michael Madsen dies at 66

image.altText: A black and white image with stars

props.synopsis: Astronomers have discovered a new object that originated outside of our Solar System — only the third ever to be found.

title.children: New interstellar object in our Solar System moving at 'incredible speed'

image.altText: ADHD meds

props.synopsis: Some of the most common medications for ADHD are set to be in short supply until the end of the year, which means plenty of people across Australia may find their pharmacist can't fill their prescriptions.

title.children: Why are ADHD meds in short supply, and what can you do about it?

image.altText: Two Palestinian women crying and embracing in a crowd.

props.synopsis: Hamas is seeking guarantees from the US that a ceasefire with Israel will lead to a lasting end to the war.

title.children: Deadly strikes hit Gaza as Israel intensifies campaign

image.altText: Muslim preacher Wissam Haddad arrives at court next to a man wearing a suit

props.synopsis: More than a decade ago political passions ran high in conservative circles about the alleged evils of 18C. This week it was only briefly back in the news cycle.

title.children: The issues that once caused political storms barely registered this week

image.altText: A flying fox with its wings outstretched, next to a tree branch filled with flying foxes

props.synopsis: A northern New South Wales man dies after contracting the state's first confirmed case of Australian bat lyssavirus.

title.children: Man dies from 'rabies-like' virus after bat bite in NSW first

image.altText: Looking down from the top of Gunlom Falls in the Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: Gunlom Falls has been closed since 2019, when damage to a sacred men's site sparked a long-running legal dispute that ultimately reached the High Court.

title.children: Popular Kakadu swimming spot reopened after six-year closure

image.altText: Britain's Catherine, Princess of Wales mid laugh during a close up interview in a beige top

props.synopsis: Catherine, the Princess of Wales, discusses her experience undergoing chemotherapy and resuming life afterwards during a visit to an English hospital.

title.children: Princess Catherine reveals more details of cancer experience during hospital visit

image.altText: Big swell and large waves on Sydney's Northern Beaches brought on by bad weather along the NSW east coast.

props.synopsis: From wild weather battering the NSW coast to a massive data leak, it has been another big week in news. Test yourself on what you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Wild weather, a data leak and a skeleton in a pot

image.altText: Australia's Daria Kasatkina in action hitting a double-handed backhand shot on a grass court at Wimbledon

props.synopsis: Australia's 16th seed Daria Kasatkina progresses to the third round of Wimbledon, while Alex de Minaur also progresses after an early slip-up.

title.children: Kasatkina and de Minaur march into third round, Vukic beaten by Sinner

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a black tshirt is kneeling down and patting a dog.

props.synopsis: Port Lincoln's mayor says the grisly nature of the alleged murder of one of the town's long-time residents has been acutely felt in the community.

title.children: Coastal town reels after man allegedly killed by reality TV contestant

image.altText: Several police cars are parked on the grass beside a fence on a country road at night.

props.synopsis: A man dies after being shot by police during an exchange of gunfire in the tiny Victorian town of Daisy Hill in the Central Goldfields.

title.children: Man shot dead by police during exchange of gunfire in regional Victoria

image.altText: The Dalai Lama watches a musical performance while sitting in front of colourful fabric an event celebrating his birthday.

props.synopsis: The Dalai Lama's message brought comfort to his followers, but it was also a declaration aimed at political forces in Beijing that have been trying to meddle with his succession.

title.children: The Dalai Lama sent a strong message to his followers — and to China

image.altText: A CCTV still shows perpetrator walking and holding what police allege is a knife.

props.synopsis: The father, mother and brother of a woman who was the victim of an "honour" stabbing in Adelaide's north have had their sentences reduced.

title.children: Sentences reduced for family members convicted over 'honour' stabbing

image.altText: A large blaze burning in scrubland at night.

props.synopsis: Greece's fire season is starting earlier and becoming more severe due to climate change, scientists say.

title.children: Wildfires threaten homes in Greece as Europe swelters through heatwave

image.altText: GettyImages-2223362195

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs have climbed into the top four after flexing their muscle against North Melbourne and spoiling their opposition's centenary celebrations.

title.children: Bulldogs successfully spoil Kangaroos' 100th anniversary celebrations

image.altText: Woman and man holding a baby, with a young boy and girl smiling at camera

props.synopsis: The wife of a fighter pilot accused of training Chinese pilots says changes to NSW jail visiting hours mean her children will not be able to regularly see their dad.

title.children: Wife of jailed former US Marines pilot furious at visitation changes

image.altText: Man in black shirt sitting at small table outside home.

props.synopsis: Terry Hayes was sexually abused by his school athletics coach in the 1970s. It's something he lives with every day, and he wants to share his story in the hope it will help increase community understanding of child sexual abuse and the lifelong impacts of it.

title.children: 'Why after so much time?': Abuse survivor on why it can take so long to talk

image.altText: A man looks over a printed resume while working at his laptop

props.synopsis: Tempted to use AI to write or improve your next cover letter? Recruiters and employment experts say it can make your job application stand out for all the wrong reasons.

title.children: The dos and don'ts of using AI for job applications

image.altText: Jonathan Bailey wearing glasses kneels down to hide in long grass next to Scarlett Johansson.

props.synopsis: Journey back to the terrifying island of dinosaur mutants in Jurassic World Rebirth, starring Jonathan Bailey and Scarlett Johansson.

title.children: Jonathan Bailey's little glasses can't save Jurassic World Rebirth

image.altText: A head-and-shoulders shot of Eileen Bond dressed in black at Alan Bond's funeral.

props.synopsis: Ms Bond died last night at the age of 87 and her son remembers her as a great mother who "lived life to the fullest".

title.children: Eileen Bond, ex-wife of controversial businessman Alan Bond, dies

image.altText: Burke speaks sitting at a desk with a sunrise backdrop behind him.

props.synopsis: The minister was busy this week with a Qantas cyber hack, a backflip on the controversial Creative Australia decision and an immigration debate.

title.children: 'The arts minister walks into a studio' sounds like a joke. Tony Burke's week was anything but

image.altText: A dad sitting on a jetty with his child next to him

props.synopsis: In the wake of the distressing sexual abuse allegations against a childcare worker in Melbourne, many parents are feeling anxious. Here's how to talk to your kids about body safety.

title.children: How to talk to your kids about body safety, boundaries and consent

image.altText: Against a dark background, Khaled Sabsabi looks off to side, wearing a dark shirt with shoulders back hand on chest.

props.synopsis: The acting chair of Australia's arts funding body, Creative Australia, has publicly apologised to artist Khaled Sabsabi for the "hurt and pain" caused after he was controversially dumped as 2026 Venice Biennale representative.

title.children: Creative Australia head apologises for 'hurt and pain' after Khaled Sabsabi dumping
